derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French porc espin, from Provençal porc espi(n), from Latin porcus 'pig' + spina 'thorn'

entry.def: A porcupine is an animal with many long, thin, sharp spikes on its back that stick out as protection when it is attacked.

means.word_mean: 1. relatively large rodents with sharp erectile bristles mingled with the fur
